page.title: 04CHARITIES OF CASTLETON
page.content: There are 3 main charities.A charity is when some money is invested on a death of a person,at their wish,and the interest is devoted to some good cause .The vicar is always one of the Committee of trustees. The main charity is called "The Castleton Charities".Robert How died 1818 and left Â£36 annual income. Champion Bray died 1825 ,left Â£28 .Samuel Needham left rent from land, Â£6 annually.Rev.Gisborne's Will investment provides Â£20 annually for flannel and coarse Yorkshire woollen cloth,now given as money to the poor on St.Thomas'Day. 12 people each receive Â£5 from all these charities . Castleton school charity gives Â£10.36 annually to the day school as does Samuel Wood's Bequest(Â£17.60) .Both these were meant to help educate poor children.
